ref.name: Data Cleaner
ref.alt: Data Cleaner app
ref.purpose: Preprocess and organize column-oriented data

sum.p: The Data Cleaner app is an interactive tool for identifying messy column-oriented data, cleaning multiple variables of data at a time, and iterating on and refining the cleaning process.

ref.name: Compute by Group
ref.alt: Compute by Group task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Summarize, transform, or filter by group in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Compute by Group task lets you interactively group data and compute summary statistics, perform transformations, or apply filters for each group. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Pivot Table
ref.alt: Pivot Table task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Summarize tabular data in pivoted table in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Pivot Table task lets you interactively summarize tabular data in a pivoted table according to column and row groups. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script. For more information about Live Editor tasks generally, see Add Interactive Tasks to a Live Script.

ref.name: Join Tables
ref.alt: Join Tables task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Combine two tables using key variables in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Join Tables task lets you interactively combine two tables by performing joins or by concatenating the tables horizontally or vertically. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Stack Table Variables
ref.alt: Stack Table Variables task in Live Editor
ref.purpose: Combine values from multiple table variables into one table variable in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Stack Table Variables task enables you to interactively stack values from multiple table or timetable variables into one variable. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script. The generated code uses the stack function.

ref.name: Unstack Table Variables
ref.alt: Unstack Table Variables task in Live Editor
ref.purpose: Distribute values from one table variable to multiple table variables in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Unstack Table Variables task lets you interactively unstack, or distribute, values in a table or timetable from one variable to multiple variables. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script. The generated code uses the unstack function.

ref.name: Data Cleaner
ref.alt: Data Cleaner app
ref.purpose: Preprocess and organize column-oriented data

sum.p: The Data Cleaner app is an interactive tool for identifying messy column-oriented data, cleaning multiple variables of data at a time, and iterating on and refining the cleaning process.

ref.name: Retime Timetable
ref.alt: Retime Timetable task in Live Editor
ref.purpose: Resample or aggregate timetable data in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Retime Timetable task lets you interactively change the row times of a timetable and then resample or aggregate the data in its variables. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Synchronize Timetables
ref.alt: Synchronize Timetables task in Live Editor
ref.purpose: Retime and combine timetables to new time vector in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Synchronize Timetables task lets you interactively collect variables from all input timetables, synchronize them to a common time vector, and return the result as a single timetable. The effect is similar to a horizontal concatenation, though the input timetables can have different row times. The task also automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Compute by Group
ref.alt: Compute by Group task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Summarize, transform, or filter by group in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Compute by Group task lets you interactively group data and compute summary statistics, perform transformations, or apply filters for each group. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Pivot Table
ref.alt: Pivot Table task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Summarize tabular data in pivoted table in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Pivot Table task lets you interactively summarize tabular data in a pivoted table according to column and row groups. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script. For more information about Live Editor tasks generally, see Add Interactive Tasks to a Live Script.

ref.name: Import Tool
ref.alt: Import Tool
ref.purpose: Import data from file

sum.p: The Import Tool lets you interactively select and import MAT, text, spreadsheet, media (image, audio, and video), and scientific data (HDF5 and netCDF) files. You can also generate MATLAB code to import similar files.

ref.name: Import Data
ref.alt: Import Data task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Import data from a file in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Import Data task lets you interactively import MAT, text, spreadsheet, media (image, audio, and video), and scientific data (HDF5 and netCDF) files. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.purpose: Import data from file

sum.p: The Import Tool lets you interactively select and import MAT, text, spreadsheet, media (image, audio, and video), and scientific data (HDF5 and netCDF) files. You can also generate MATLAB code to import similar files.

ref.name: Workspace Panel
ref.alt: Workspace panel
ref.purpose: Interactively manage workspace contents

sum.p: The Workspace panel enables you to view and interactively manage the contents of the MATLAB workspace. Using this tool, you can:

ref.name: Variables Editor
ref.alt: Variables editor
ref.purpose: Interactively view, edit, and analyze workspace variables

sum.p: The Variables editor enables you to view, edit, and analyze variables in the MATLAB workspace. Changes that you make to variables in the Variables editor occur in the current workspace as soon as you enter them. For example, you can use the Variables editor to:

ref.name: Import Tool
ref.alt: Import Tool
ref.purpose: Import data from file

sum.p: The Import Tool lets you interactively select and import MAT, text, spreadsheet, media (image, audio, and video), and scientific data (HDF5 and netCDF) files. You can also generate MATLAB code to import similar files.

ref.name: Import Data
ref.alt: Import Data task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Import data from a file in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Import Data task lets you interactively import MAT, text, spreadsheet, media (image, audio, and video), and scientific data (HDF5 and netCDF) files. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Serial Explorer
ref.alt: Serial Explorer app
ref.purpose: Communicate with devices connected to serial port

sum.p: The Serial Explorer app creates a connection to a serial port on your machine. After you connect to a serial port, you can communicate with it, plot and analyze data, export data to the workspace, and generate MATLAB code.

ref.name: Hardware Manager
ref.alt: Hardware Manager app
ref.purpose: Discover and get started with your hardware

sum.p: Hardware Manager allows you to find and connect to your hardware from MATLAB.

ref.name: TCP/IP Explorer
ref.alt: TCP/IP Explorer app
ref.purpose: Connect to and communicate with TCP/IP server

sum.p: The TCP/IP Explorer app creates a TCP/IP client connection to an existing TCP/IP server. After you connect to a server, you can communicate with it, plot and analyze data, export data to the workspace, and generate MATLAB code.

ref.name: Hardware Manager
ref.alt: Hardware Manager app
ref.purpose: Discover and get started with your hardware

sum.p: Hardware Manager allows you to find and connect to your hardware from MATLAB.

cat.title: Get Started with MATLAB Support Package for Arduino Hardware

ref.name: Arduino Explorer
ref.purpose: Configure and control Arduino

sum.p: Use the Arduino Explorer to interactively set up an Arduino board, read, write, and analyze data from the board, and generate code.

cat.title: Deploy Arduino Functions to Arduino Hardware Using MATLAB Function Block
Troubleshooting in MATLAB Support Package for Arduino Hardware

ref.name: Raspberry Pi Resource Monitor App
ref.alt: Raspberry Pi Resource Monitor App
ref.purpose: Monitor and manage Raspberry Pi resources

sum.p: Monitor and manage Raspberry Pi resources such as MATLAB/Simulink deployed processes, CPU, RAM, SD card, external peripheral devices, and interfaces.

cat.title: Build Standalone Applications and Web Apps
Troubleshooting in MATLAB Support Package for LEGO MINDSTORMS EV3 Hardware

ref.name: Acquire Webcam Image
ref.alt: Acquire Webcam Image task in Live Editor
ref.purpose: Acquire snapshot from webcam in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Acquire Webcam Image task enables you to interactively connect to a webcam, set properties based on the live video, and capture images. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script. For more information about Live Editor tasks, see Add Interactive Tasks to a Live Script.

cat.title: Build Standalone Executables and Web Apps
Troubleshooting in MATLAB Support Package for USB Webcams
Troubleshooting in MATLAB Support Package for IP Cameras
Troubleshooting in MATLAB Support Package for Ryze Tello Drones
Troubleshooting in MATLAB Support Package for Parrot Drones

ref.name: Data Cleaner
ref.alt: Data Cleaner app
ref.purpose: Preprocess and organize column-oriented data

sum.p: The Data Cleaner app is an interactive tool for identifying messy column-oriented data, cleaning multiple variables of data at a time, and iterating on and refining the cleaning process.

ref.name: Clean Missing Data
ref.alt: Clean Missing Data task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Find, fill, or remove missing data in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Clean Missing Data task lets you interactively handle missing data values such as NaN or <missing>. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Clean Outlier Data
ref.alt: Clean Outlier Data task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Find, fill, or remove outliers in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Clean Outlier Data task lets you interactively handle outliers in data. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Smooth Data
ref.alt: Smooth Data task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Smooth noisy data in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Smooth Data task lets you interactively smooth noisy data. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Find Local Extrema
ref.alt: Find Local Extrema task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Find local maxima and minima in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Find Local Extrema task lets you interactively find local maxima and local minima in data. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Find Change Points
ref.alt: Find Change Points task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Find abrupt changes in data in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Find Change Points task lets you interactively find abrupt changes in the mean, variance, or slope and intercept of data. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Stack Table Variables
ref.alt: Stack Table Variables task in Live Editor
ref.purpose: Combine values from multiple table variables into one table variable in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Stack Table Variables task enables you to interactively stack values from multiple table or timetable variables into one variable. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script. The generated code uses the stack function.

ref.name: Unstack Table Variables
ref.alt: Unstack Table Variables task in Live Editor
ref.purpose: Distribute values from one table variable to multiple table variables in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Unstack Table Variables task lets you interactively unstack, or distribute, values in a table or timetable from one variable to multiple variables. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script. The generated code uses the unstack function.

ref.name: Retime Timetable
ref.alt: Retime Timetable task in Live Editor
ref.purpose: Resample or aggregate timetable data in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Retime Timetable task lets you interactively change the row times of a timetable and then resample or aggregate the data in its variables. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Normalize Data
ref.alt: Normalize Data task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Center and scale data in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Normalize Data task lets you interactively normalize data by choosing centering and scaling methods, such as z-score. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Find and Remove Trends
ref.alt: Find and Remove Trends task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Find and remove polynomial or periodic trends from data in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Find and Remove Trends task lets you interactively identify polynomial or periodic trends in data and return or remove them. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script. For more information about Live Editor tasks generally, see Add Interactive Tasks to a Live Script.

ref.name: Pivot Table
ref.alt: Pivot Table task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Summarize tabular data in pivoted table in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Pivot Table task lets you interactively summarize tabular data in a pivoted table according to column and row groups. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script. For more information about Live Editor tasks generally, see Add Interactive Tasks to a Live Script.

ref.name: Compute by Group
ref.alt: Compute by Group task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Summarize, transform, or filter by group in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Compute by Group task lets you interactively group data and compute summary statistics, perform transformations, or apply filters for each group. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Create Plot
ref.alt: Create Plot task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Interactively create and explore visualizations in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Create Plot task lets you interactively create and explore visualizations for your data. Choose visualizations from a list of categories or let the task recommend them based on your workspace variables. The task automatically generates MATLAB code and adds labels to the generated visualization.

ref.name: Property Inspector
ref.alt: Property Inspector
ref.purpose: Open Property Inspector

sum.p: The Property Inspector enables you to interactively modify objects, such as graphics objects. When you select an object, the Property Inspector shows a list of object properties. You can change property values by editing the fields that appear next to each property name.

ref.name: Experiment Manager
ref.alt: Experiment Manager app
ref.purpose: Explore parameters in your MATLAB code and compare experiment results

sum.p: You can use the Experiment Manager app to create experiments to run your MATLAB code using various parameter values and compare results. For example, you can use Experiment Manager to explore how the solution to a system of differential equations responds to different coefficient values or how it evolves from different initial conditions.

ref.name: Optimize
ref.alt: Optimize task in Live Editor
ref.purpose: Optimize in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Optimize task lets you interactively optimize a nonlinear objective function or solve a nonlinear equation. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script.

ref.name: Solve ODE
ref.alt: Solve ODE task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Solve system of ordinary differential equations in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Solve ODE task lets you interactively solve a system of ordinary differential equations. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your script.

ref.name: Create Plot
ref.alt: Create Plot task in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Interactively create and explore visualizations in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Create Plot task lets you interactively create and explore visualizations for your data. Choose visualizations from a list of categories or let the task recommend them based on your workspace variables. The task automatically generates MATLAB code and adds labels to the generated visualization.

ref.name: Colormap Editor
ref.alt: Colormap Editor window
ref.purpose: Open colormap editor

sum.p: The Colormap Editor allows you to customize the colormap of the selected figure or axes. See the More About section for more information about colormaps.

ref.name: Property Inspector
ref.alt: Property Inspector
ref.purpose: Open Property Inspector

sum.p: The Property Inspector enables you to interactively modify objects, such as graphics objects. When you select an object, the Property Inspector shows a list of object properties. You can change property values by editing the fields that appear next to each property name.

cat.title: Creating, Deleting, and Querying Graphics Objects

ref.name: Class Diagram Viewer
ref.alt: Class Diagram Viewer app
ref.purpose: Create diagrams with class details and hierarchies

sum.p: The Class Diagram Viewer app enables you to create diagrams that show class implementation details and hierarchies. You can use this app to explore class structures and share class diagrams with others. These diagrams can include details about:

cat.title: Construct and Work with Object Arrays

ref.name: Class Diagram Viewer
ref.alt: Class Diagram Viewer app
ref.purpose: Create diagrams with class details and hierarchies

sum.p: The Class Diagram Viewer app enables you to create diagrams that show class implementation details and hierarchies. You can use this app to explore class structures and share class diagrams with others. These diagrams can include details about:

ref.name: App Designer
ref.alt: App Designer development environment
ref.purpose: Create apps interactively

sum.p: App Designer is an interactive development environment for designing an app layout and programming its behavior.

ref.name: Code Analyzer
ref.purpose: Identify and address code issues

sum.p: The Code Analyzer app generates a report of issues identified in code within a selected file or folder and its subfolders.

ref.name: Code Compatibility Analyzer
ref.purpose: Identify and address compatibility issues against current version of MATLAB

sum.p: The Code Compatibility Analyzer app generates a report of syntax errors, code incompatibilities, and new functionalities that might improve the code in a selected folder and its subfolders.

ref.name: Profiler
ref.alt: Profiler app showing the results from profiling the solvelotka function. The Profiler app shows the results using both a flame graph and a table containing the list of functions called with the times each function took to run.
ref.purpose: Run code and measure execution time to improve performance

sum.p: The Profiler app enables you to profile your code interactively. Profiling is a way to measure the time it takes to run your code and identify where MATLAB spends the most time. After you identify which functions are consuming the most time, you can evaluate them for possible performance improvements. You also can profile your code to determine which lines of code do not run. Determining which lines of code do not run is useful when developing tests for your code, or as a debugging tool to help isolate a problem in your code.

ref.name: Dependency Analyzer
ref.alt: Dependency Analyzer app. Dependency graph in the center. toolstrip on the top, Legend pane on the left, and Properties panel on the right.
ref.purpose: Visualize dependencies, find required files, and assess the impact of changes

sum.p: The Dependency Analyzer app is an interactive tool for visualizing and analyzing dependencies among files.

ref.name: Branch Manager
ref.alt: Branch Manager tool. Toolstrip on the top, commits graph in the center, branches, remotes, and tags on the left, and details about selected commits on the right.
ref.purpose: View Git repository history and manage local and remote Git branches and repositories

sum.p: The Branch Manager is an interactive tool for visualizing and managing local and remote Git branches, worktrees, and repositories.

ref.name: Test Browser
ref.alt: Test Browser app
ref.purpose: Run MATLAB tests and view results

sum.p: The Test Browser app enables you to run script-based, function-based, and class-based tests interactively.

cat.title: Build MATLAB Interface to C++ Library

ref.name: Generate C++ Interface
ref.purpose: Generate definition file for C++ interface library in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Generate C++ Interface task lets you interactively configure and generate a library definition file for a C++ interface. This task accomplishes one step in the workflow to publish a MATLAB interface to a C++ library defined by C/C++ files and compiled library files. The Generate C++ Interface task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script. For more information about Live Editor tasks generally, see Add Interactive Tasks to a Live Script.

cat.title: Use Prebuilt MATLAB Interface to C++ Library
Call C/C++ MEX Functions from MATLAB
Write C++ Functions Callable from MATLAB (MEX Files)

ref.name: Run Python Code
ref.alt: Run Python statements or script files in the Live Editor
ref.purpose: Run Python statements or script files in the Live Editor

sum.p: The Run Python Code task lets you interactively run Python code or files. The task automatically generates MATLAB code for your live script. For more information about Live Editor tasks generally, see Add Interactive Tasks to a Live Script.

cat.title: Write COM Applications to Work with MATLAB
Call MATLAB Functions Using REST Function Service
Call Web Services from MATLAB Using HTTP
Call Web Services from MATLAB Using WSDL
Write C Functions Callable from MATLAB (MEX Files)
Write C Programs to Read MAT File Data
Write Fortran Functions Callable from MATLAB (MEX Files)
Write Fortran Programs to Read MAT File Data

ref.name: Settings Window
ref.alt: Settings window displaying the MATLAB General Settings page
ref.purpose: Open Settings window to view and change settings

sum.p: MATLAB provides various settings for customizing MATLAB. You can use the Settings window to interactively access and modify MATLAB settings.

ref.name: Support Package Installer
ref.purpose: Install support for third-party hardware or software

sum.p: Use Support Package Installer to install support packages. The support packages add support for specific third-party hardware or software to specific MathWorks products.
